docs.lead_paragraph: As consumers sign up for health insurance in the final days of open enrollment, many find the names of plans unhelpful, confusing and in some cases misleading.

headline.main: Names of Health Plans Sow Customer Confusion
headline.print_headline: Names of Health Plans Sow Customer Confusion

docs.abstract: Many consumers signing up for health insurance in final days of open enrollment find names of plans unhelpful, confusing and in some cases misleading.
docs.snippet: As consumers sign up for health insurance in the final days of open enrollment, many find the names of plans unhelpful, confusing and in some cases misleading.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court should reject the claim of religious infringement in the health care law’s contraception mandate.
docs.abstract: Editorial contends that the Supreme Court should reject the claim of religious infringement in the health care law's contraception mandate, which has been made by corporations Hobby Lobby and Conestoga Wood Specialties; warns of the ripple effects should the court find in the companies' favor.
docs.snippet: The Supreme Court should reject the claim of religious infringement in the health care law’s contraception mandate.

docs.lead_paragraph: A day after a federal judge struck down Michigan’s voter-approved ban on same-sex marriages, gay couples raced to clerk’s offices to exchange wedding vows.

headline.main: For Gay Couples in Michigan, a Day of Joy Ends in Legal Uncertainty
headline.print_headline: For Gay Couples in Michigan, a Day of Joy Ends in Legal Uncertainty

docs.abstract: Gay couples in Michigan race to clerk’s offices to exchange wedding vows day after federal judge struck down state’s voter-approved ban on same-sex marriages; euphoria quickly turns to disappointment when United States Court of Appeals for Sixth Circuit, in Cincinnati, suspends ruling, immediately halting same-sex weddings in state.
docs.snippet: A day after a federal judge struck down Michigan’s voter-approved ban on same-sex marriages, gay couples raced to clerk’s offices to exchange wedding vows.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: John Eligon reported from Ann Arbor, and Erik Eckholm from New York. Emma G. Fitzsimmons contributed reporting from New York, and Jack Healy from Denver.
byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON and ERIK ECKHOLM

docs.lead_paragraph: Economists’ advice on policy is based not just on their understanding of how the world works, but also on political philosophy — their judgments about what makes a good society.

headline.main: When the Scientist Is Also a Philosopher
headline.print_headline: When the Scientist Is Also a Philosopher

docs.abstract: N Gregory Mankiw Economic View column contends that advice from economists on policy is based not just on their understanding of how the world works, but also on political philosophy--their judgements about what makes a good society; cautions that economics is a science in its infancy, and that recommendations should be made with humility.
docs.snippet: Economists’ advice on policy is based not just on their understanding of how the world works, but also on political philosophy — their judgments about what makes a good society.

docs.lead_paragraph: In “Savage Girl,” Jean Zimmerman turns to the Gilded Age for a sweeping narrative that raises touchy questions about what it means to be civilized.
docs.abstract: Marilyn Stasio reviews books Savage Girl by Jean Zimmerman, Watching You by Michael Robotham, The Dead of Summer by Mari Jungstedt and Don't Look For Me by Loren D Estleman.
docs.snippet: In “Savage Girl,” Jean Zimmerman turns to the Gilded Age for a sweeping narrative that raises touchy questions about what it means to be civilized.

docs.abstract: Russia’s decision to annex Crimea and the still missing Malaysian Airlines flight will dominate the conversation on the Sunday talk shows.

docs.lead_paragraph: With the promise of affordable health insurance under President Barack Obama's law, many Americans with serious illnesses are finding relatively low monthly premiums and, in many cases, access to insurance for the first time.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a story March 22 about how Maine lobstermen are responding to the federal health insurance law, The Associated Press erroneously reported on factors considered when determining subsidies for insurance policies. Assets, including the boats lobstermen own, do not factor into the determination of subsidies.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hardship exemptions won’t undermine health care reforms, as Republican leaders contend.
docs.abstract: Editorial contests Republican claim that Pres Obama has abandoned health care reform requirement that most people obtain insurance or pay a penalty; maintains extensive documentation must be produced to escape penalty and rejects Republican claim that virtually anyone can do so.
docs.snippet: Hardship exemptions won’t undermine health care reforms, as Republican leaders contend.
